com.parse4cn1

Class ParseBatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.parse4cn1.ParseBatch

  • public class ParseBatch
extends java.lang.Object
    This class enables issuing of batch requests.

    Batching of requests helps reduce the amount of network round trips performed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ParseBatch.EBatchOpType
      An enumeration of batch operation types.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      ParseBatch addObject(ParseObject object, ParseBatch.EBatchOpType opType)
      Adds an object to the batch to be executed.

      Adds multiple objects to the batch to be executed.
      static ParseBatch create()
      Creates a new ParseBatch instance.
      boolean execute()
      Executes the batch operation.
      java.util.Map<ParseObject,ParseException> getErrors()
      Retrieves the error returned per ParseObject by the Parse server when the batch was executed.

      Indicates the status of the batch operation.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static ParseBatch create()
        Creates a new ParseBatch instance.
        Returns:
        The newly created object.

      • addObject

        public ParseBatch addObject(ParseObject object,
                            ParseBatch.EBatchOpType opType)
                     throws ParseException
        Adds an object to the batch to be executed.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to be added to the batch.
        opType - The type of operation to be performed on object.
        Returns:
        this to enable chaining.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if the object does not meet the constraints for opType, for example, an objectId is required for ParseBatch.EBatchOpType.UPDATE and ParseBatch.EBatchOpType.DELETE but should not exist for ParseBatch.EBatchOpType.CREATE. because it already has an objectId.

      • addObjects

        public ParseBatch addObjects(java.util.Collection<? extends ParseObject> objects,
                             ParseBatch.EBatchOpType opType)
                      throws ParseException
        Adds multiple objects to the batch to be executed.
        Parameters:
        objects - The objects to be added to the batch.
        opType - The type of operation to be performed on ALL objects.
        Returns:
        this to enable chaining.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if any of the objects does not meet the constraints for opType, for example, an objectId is required for ParseBatch.EBatchOpType.UPDATE and ParseBatch.EBatchOpType.DELETE but should not exist for ParseBatch.EBatchOpType.CREATE. because it already has an objectId.

      • execute

        public boolean execute()
                throws ParseException
        Executes the batch operation.

        All ParseObjects in the batch for which the requested operation was successful will also be updated with the response received from the server.

        Returns:
        true if the all the operations in the batch are successfully executed. This is the same value returned by isSucceeded().
        Throws:
        ParseException - if executing the batch operation itself fails, for example due to batch size exceeding limit.

      • isSucceeded

        public boolean isSucceeded()
        Indicates the status of the batch operation.
        Returns:
        true if the requested command is successfully performed on each object in the batch; otherwise returns false.

      • getErrors

        public java.util.Map<ParseObject,ParseException> getErrors()
                                                    throws ParseException
        Retrieves the error returned per ParseObject by the Parse server when the batch was executed.
        Returns:
        A read-only map of all ParseObjects in the batch to result returned by the server. A null value indicates that the operation was successful for that key (ParseObject).
        Throws:
        ParseException - if this method is invoked before execute().
